Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can draw a healthy plant that has enough water and light, clearly showing vibrant leaves and a strong stem.
The student can draw a plant that has no water and accurately depict it with wilted leaves and a drooping stem, clearly differentiating it from the healthy plant.
The student can draw a plant that has no light and illustrate it with pale leaves or showing signs of stress, distinguishable from the healthy plant.
The student can use their drawing to effectively show that plants need light to live and grow by depicting how plants deteriorate without light.
The student can use their drawing to accurately demonstrate that plants need water to live and grow by comparing the features of healthy and water-deprived plants.
CANNOT: Occasionally, the student might omit small details like minor leaf discoloration on the plant that lacks light (minor oversight but overall understanding is clear).
The student may sometimes forget to label the light source or water component in the drawing, though this doesn't hinder overall understanding.
